intro: Swainsona paucifoliolata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved swainsona, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers that are typically arranged in spikes, and it is often found in dry, rocky habitats. Swainsona paucifoliolata is known for its ability to fix nitrogen in the soil, making it an important plant in ecological contexts.
